description: black-and-white crosshatch drawing of a figure in profile
inscription: Inscribed in pencil, lower margin: from memory of a stranger seen in cafeteria | inscribed in pencil on the inner mat, below the print: Chicago 1932 Head
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed and dated in pencil, LR: Biederman 1932
text: Charles Biederman is known for his colorful abstract pictures, which often have small blocks attached to break the surface of the picture plane. This appears to be a rare example of a print made early in his career, when he was still making figural art.
title: Head
